one_reviews_text: downside is clues are useless at times and this is the only vr game that makes me qweezy
review_feedback:
Hello,
Thank you for your comment. Sorry to read that the experience may have been uncomfortable. Did you try with the teleport locomotion ? if you prefer the free locomotion, you can also set the speed of movement and rotation in the main menu to get a more pleasant experience. If you have any other suggestions for improvement, please let me know. Thank you !

review_title: Well worth the price, a fun couple hours
one_reviews_text: What you see is what you get here. There are 3 areas, each with their own puzzles. There are a variety of puzzles, from easy to hard. If you run into trouble there are two levels of hint for each puzzle. I only needed those a couple of times and with one exception I wish I had just spent more time thinking about the solution. The graphics are pretty basic, but they serve their purpose well. I only found one bug: the teleport orientation does nothing. Doesn't really affect gameplay once you realize. It is a brand new game, I'm sure the dev will fix it soon anyway.

played a lot of escape games on steam, most are not made very well apart from abode 1 & 2  the room VR, extreme escape, conductor and a few others, this game is realy well made from the menu's to the movement, none of that collision where objects go flying out your hand, love the puzzles, after a little thinking they make sense and are fun to work out.
